pr_title: Add unit tests for offline predictions

timeline.message: Add unit tests for offline predictions

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -62,13 +64,23 @@
      * @param context the Android context
      */
     TensorFlowTextClassificationService(@NonNull Context context) {

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: This test is to directly test the behavior of fetchSentiment. How about if I write more tests for blocking behavior in the future when I improve on the current latch design?
replies.author: raphkim

timeline.bodyText: Since both of these are in @Before scope, I would move this when arrangement up right underneath them, there, too.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: I envision adding more tests in this suite that tests different types of assets to load (for different predictions verbs), so I structured it like this intentionally.
replies.author: raphkim

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: Ah I was wrestling with that for a bit, but I think I got it now!
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Haha yea, it's a compound statement with a lot of syntax...
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: (This will go away with Await, too. But nit: MILLISECONDS! Not MICROSECONDS.)
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: oh wow i guess I shouldn't have relied on autocomplete LOL
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: This exact thing happens to me all the time. It's probably something IntelliSense could improve.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: I was considering that, but I think the way I currently have it written makes it easier to document what each number means
replies.author: raphkim

timeline.bodyText: Instead of mocking the dictionary, can your provide text_classification_vocab.txt, and use real one?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: I was trying to stay away from relying on androidx and robolectric if possible. I think this is sufficient for now.
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText:
There are pros and cons -- the less you mock, the more "real" your test is, and the more coverage you get. Plus, you'll be able to keep final on your class, to keep it "closed."
The only con is really just that Robolectric is slow.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams
jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: interfaces are almost always great, but I think we shouldn't overuse it either. TextClassificationModel would be a bit too specific of a concept to be appropriate as an interface, and we are not really getting concrete advantage out of it besides allowing its instance to be final.
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Yea, actually, agreed. There aren't going be multiple text classification services -- it's the TensorFlow plugin. The only alternate would be for test purposes. So I do agree, that's overkill.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
